summary: This bill, the Working Class Bonus Tax Relief Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a deduction for a portion of bonuses received by individuals. The deduction is capped at 15% of non-bonus wages from the same employer. It includes income limitations for eligibility, and terminates after December 31, 2029. The bill also specifies how this deduction interacts with other tax provisions, providing benefits to both itemizers and non-itemizers, and directs the Secretary of the Treasury to modify withholding tables accordingly. The effective date is the date of enactment.
